did.abstract: Affiliate of the National Urban League. Records include historical information file, administrative files, topical files, and photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group (donor no. 4177) was first deposited with the library in 1964. Additional deposits were made in 1981 and 1995.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Grand Rapids Urban League Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Brough Community Association of Grand Rapids, Michigan was formally incorporated on June 4, 1943. The early aim of the organization was to provide recreational and self-development opportunities for the Grand Rapids Black community. In 1947, the board of directors, anxious to improve and enlarge the programs of the organization, decided to affiliate with the National Urban League. The name of the organization was now changed to the Grand Rapids Urban League and Brough Community Association.

Paul Phillips was named executive secretary of the Association in 1947. Under his leadership, the organization implemented a full Urban League program, and initiated departments in industrial relations, community services, and group work. It also sponsored a women's guild which assisted and made improvements in community race relations.

The League took great pride in opening new employment opportunities for the city's Blacks, as bus drivers, nurses, librarians, and taxi cab drivers. It also set up a scholarship fund to aid students who wanted to attend college. With the passage of years, the Urban League phased out its recreation program, and concentrated instead upon matters of employment, community relations, and housing.
In 1967, the organization amended its articles of incorporation shortening its name to the Grand Rapids Urban League.

scopecontent.p: The records of the Grand Rapids Urban League document its activities as a civil rights and social service organization serving the African-American community in Grand Rapids. The records have been arranged into four series: Historical/Background Material, Administration Records, Topical Files, and Photographs. The series date from the organization's founding in 1943 up to the mid-1980s. There are numerous gaps in the files with the bulk of the records dating before 1970.

scopecontent.p: The Historical Files series consists of a single folder of clippings and miscellaneous material on the history of the Grand rapids Urban League.
The Administrative Records series includes the organization's articles of incorporation, minutes of the board of directors and various committees, correspondence files, and reports.

odd.p: (files and record books containing minutes, reports, memoranda, background information, agenda, etc.)

scopecontent.p: The Topical Files series, alphabetically arranged, includes material on the Urban League's annual meetings, files on various special committees and projects, and reports and studies.

did.unittitle: Long Range Planning Committee, Five Year Plan 1988-1993
"Four Studies of Grand Rapids Public Schools," April 1964
"Housing of Nonwhites in Grand Rapids, Mich.," May 1964
"The Negro Population of Grand Rapids, Mich.: 1940," April 1940
"A Review of the Progress and Activities of the Brough Community Association," September 10-24, 1945

scopecontent.p: The Photographs Series includes prints of activities of the Grand Rapids Urban League, especially its activities with children (ca. 1950), later activities of the League, and portraits of its secretary, Paul Phillips.
